cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a method for image fusion, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. The method involves solving a generalized Sylvester matrix equation, which is a topic in linear algebra and numerical methods (cs.IT). The proposed method is more efficient and robust compared to a previous method, which involves frequency domain operations and blurring kernel assumptions (cs.CV). The paper also discusses the use of priors, which is a topic in machine learning and statistics (cs.LG). The proposed method involves fewer computational operations, which is a topic in multimedia processing (cs.MM). Finally, the paper proposes a new algorithm, which is a topic in signal processing (cs.SI).
